conclusion: Semicircular glass brick with radius R and critical angle γ; parallel rays strike base at angle (π - γ); find width of base through which light passes.
Light rays refract entering the glass brick at angle γ from vertical.
Inside the glass, rays travel straight until hitting curved surface; exit if angle of incidence < γ.
Boundary ray hits curved surface at critical angle γ; smaller angle rays exit, larger angle rays reflect.
Angle of incidence at curved surface equals angle between ray and normal (radius).
Origin at center of semicircle; flat base from (-R, 0) to (R, 0).
Incoming rays at angle γ from vertical have direction vector (sin γ, cos γ).
Critical ray tangent to circle of radius R·cos γ centered at origin.
Critical ray starts at (R·sin γ, 0); rays between (0, 0) and (R·sin γ, 0) exit.
Rays between (-R, 0) and (0, 0) also exit by symmetry.
Total width of base through which light passes is R(1 + sin γ).
Final answer: Width of portion of base through which light passes is R(1 + sin γ).
